answers.answer: I strongly recommend always discussing your treatment with your treating physician before stopping your treamtent regimine. Obviously with the exception of serious side effects like allergies. Call the urologist and let him/her know what happened, what you did and why. It is possible the stone moved. You would likely pee more with tamsulosin because it relaxes the ureters and sphincter muscles.

question: I noticed that i was having increased thrist and urination symptoms , i consulted a urologist who tested my blood and urine sample and did ultrasound scan of kidneys and bladder etc region , a very small stone was detected in the right kidneybl but doctor told me that it is not a trouble now .He gave me following medicationLevofloxacin 250 mgtamsulocin hcl .2 mgtolterodine L Tartrate  1 mgI took these medicine for 4 days and my condition became much worse and i discontinued useI thought that i have developed diabetes so i went for fasting blood sugar test it came out to be 98 .and doctor told me i do not have diabetesRecently i have started using the medication after a break excluding tolterodine and smegum is seen on penis foreskin .
title: Urinary Infection or diabetes
